remarks: For any point and any open interval of ` RR ` containing that point, there is a closed-below open-above dyadic rational interval which contains that point and is included in the original interval. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 12-Oct-2017.)
statement:

dya2ioc.1 $e |- I = ( x e. ZZ , n e. ZZ |-> ( ( x / ( 2 ^ n ) ) [,) ( ( x + 1 ) / ( 2 ^ n ) ) ) ) $.
dya2icoseg2 $p |- ( ( X e. RR /\ E e. ran (,) /\ X e. E ) -> E. b e. ran I ( X e. b /\ b C_ E ) ) $.
$d E b x $.
$d I b x $.
$d X b x $.
$d b n x $.
